trans-unit.source: Pricing tier recommendations for Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier recommendations for Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: When changing pricing tiers in the Azure portal, pricing tier recommendations are provided that recommend the tier that is best suited for running an existing Azure SQL Database’s workload.
trans-unit.target: When changing pricing tiers in the Azure portal, pricing tier recommendations are provided that recommend the tier that is best suited for running an existing Azure SQL Database’s workload.

trans-unit.source: SQL Database pricing tier recommendations
trans-unit.target: SQL Database pricing tier recommendations

trans-unit.source: When changing pricing tiers in the Azure portal, pricing tier recommendations are provided that recommend the tier that is best suited for running an existing Azure SQL Database’s workload.
trans-unit.target: When changing pricing tiers in the Azure portal, pricing tier recommendations are provided that recommend the tier that is best suited for running an existing Azure SQL Database’s workload.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Pricing tier recommendations are only available for Web and Business databases, and only available in the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Pricing tier recommendations are only available for Web and Business databases, and only available in the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure analyzes current performance and feature requirements by assessing historical resource usage for a SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Azure analyzes current performance and feature requirements by assessing historical resource usage for a SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the minimum acceptable service tier is determined based on the size of the database, and enabled [business continuity](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) features.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the minimum acceptable service tier is determined based on the size of the database, and enabled [business continuity](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) features.

trans-unit.source: This information is analyzed and the service tier and performance level that is best suited for running the database’s typical workload and maintaining it's current feature set is recommended.
trans-unit.target: This information is analyzed and the service tier and performance level that is best suited for running the database’s typical workload and maintaining it's current feature set is recommended.

trans-unit.source: The service examines the previous 15 to 30 days of historical data (resource usage, database size, and database activity) and performs a comparison between the amount of resources consumed and the actual limitations of the currently available service tiers and performance levels.
trans-unit.target: The service examines the previous 15 to 30 days of historical data (resource usage, database size, and database activity) and performs a comparison between the amount of resources consumed and the actual limitations of the currently available service tiers and performance levels.

trans-unit.source: Data is analyzed in 15 second intervals and each interval's resultset is categorized into the existing service tier and performance level that is best suited for handling that resultset's workload.
trans-unit.target: Data is analyzed in 15 second intervals and each interval's resultset is categorized into the existing service tier and performance level that is best suited for handling that resultset's workload.

trans-unit.source: These 15 second samples are then aggregated into the larger 15-30 day analysis and the service tier and performance level that can optimally handle 95% of the historical workload is recommended.
trans-unit.target: These 15 second samples are then aggregated into the larger 15-30 day analysis and the service tier and performance level that can optimally handle 95% of the historical workload is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Based on your database's usage, there are currently 2 categories of recommendations that can be encountered:
trans-unit.target: Based on your database's usage, there are currently 2 categories of recommendations that can be encountered:

trans-unit.source: Recommendation
trans-unit.target: Recommendation

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Upgrade
trans-unit.target: Upgrade

trans-unit.source: Upgrade to a new tier.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade to a new tier.

trans-unit.source: Unavailable
trans-unit.target: Unavailable

trans-unit.source: A database requires a minimum workload or approximately 14 days of activity.
trans-unit.target: A database requires a minimum workload or approximately 14 days of activity.

trans-unit.source: There is not enough data to provide a valid recommendation.
trans-unit.target: There is not enough data to provide a valid recommendation.

trans-unit.source: Getting pricing tier recommendations
trans-unit.target: Getting pricing tier recommendations

trans-unit.source: Get pricing tier recommendations by selecting an existing Web or Business database and clicking on the **Pricing tier** tile.
trans-unit.target: Get pricing tier recommendations by selecting an existing Web or Business database and clicking on the **Pricing tier** tile.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Click **BROWSE** in the left menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **BROWSE** in the left menu.

trans-unit.source: Click **SQL databases** in the **Browse** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **SQL databases** in the **Browse** blade.

trans-unit.source: In the **SQL databases** blade, click the database that you want the service to analyze.
trans-unit.target: In the **SQL databases** blade, click the database that you want the service to analyze.

trans-unit.source: ![Select database][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Select database][1]

trans-unit.source: On the database blade, select the **Pricing tier** tile.
trans-unit.target: On the database blade, select the **Pricing tier** tile.

trans-unit.source: ![Pricing tier][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Pricing tier][2]

trans-unit.source: After clicking the **Pricing tier** tile you will be presented with the **Recommended pricing tiers** blade where you can click the suggested tier and then click the **Select** button to change to that tier.
trans-unit.target: After clicking the **Pricing tier** tile you will be presented with the **Recommended pricing tiers** blade where you can click the suggested tier and then click the **Select** button to change to that tier.

trans-unit.source: ![Sign up for the preview][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Sign up for the preview][4]

trans-unit.source: Optionally, click **View usage details** to open the **Pricing Tier Recommendation Details** blade where you can view the recommended tier for the database, a feature comparison between current and recommended tiers, and a graph of the historical resource usage analysis.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, click **View usage details** to open the **Pricing Tier Recommendation Details** blade where you can view the recommended tier for the database, a feature comparison between current and recommended tiers, and a graph of the historical resource usage analysis.

trans-unit.source: ![Sign up for the preview][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Sign up for the preview][5]

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier recommendations provide an automated experience for gathering telemetry data for each SQL database and recommending the best service tier/performance level combination based on a database's actual performance needs and feature requirements.
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier recommendations provide an automated experience for gathering telemetry data for each SQL database and recommending the best service tier/performance level combination based on a database's actual performance needs and feature requirements.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Pricing tier** tile on a database blade to see pricing tier recommendations.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Pricing tier** tile on a database blade to see pricing tier recommendations.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Depending on the details of your specific database, performing an upgrade or downgrade usually does not happen instantaneously.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the details of your specific database, performing an upgrade or downgrade usually does not happen instantaneously.

trans-unit.source: The management portal will provide notifications as the database transitions to it's new tier, or you can monitor the upgrade status by querying the [sys.dm_operation_status (Azure SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) view in the SQL Database Server's master database.
trans-unit.target: The management portal will provide notifications as the database transitions to it's new tier, or you can monitor the upgrade status by querying the [sys.dm_operation_status (Azure SQL Database)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) view in the SQL Database Server's master database.
